nodes.text: The Baroonda Course was a podracing course that shared its name with the city of Baroonda, where The Rawani Cup podracing event was held. Prior to his disappearance in 7954 C.R.C., podracer Neva Kee was considered the rising star of the course according to Hosnian Prime police commissioner Exantor Divo.

The Baroonda Course was first mentioned in the 2018 reference book Star Wars: Scum and Villainy: Case Files on the Galaxy's Most Notorious, which was written by Pablo Hidalgo. As well as the city mentioned in Star Wars: Galaxy's Edge, which opened to guests at Disneyland Park on May 31, 2019, the course shares its name with the Star Wars Legends planet Baroonda, which first appeared as the location of several podracing courses in the 1999 video game Star Wars Episode I: Racer.
